abstract: Last week, the smart money seemed to be on Laurence D. Fink as the next chief of Merrill Lynch. The founder and chief executive of BlackRock, the large investment firm partly owned by Merrill, was being widely touted as the front-runner for the position left by E. Stanley O’Neal, who resigned in the wake of a multibillion write-down at the investment bank.
lead_paragraph: Last week, the smart money seemed to be on Laurence D. Fink as the next chief of Merrill Lynch. The founder and chief executive of BlackRock, the large investment firm partly owned by Merrill, was being widely touted as the front-runner for the position left by E. Stanley O’Neal, who resigned in the wake of a multibillion write-down at the investment bank.
